flawed_nl_solution:
If Sierra is currently 30 years old, 10 times her age is 30*10 = <<30*10=3000>>3000.
Twenty more than 10 times Sierra's age is 3000+20 = 3020
3020 is 40 less than ten times Diaz's age so 10 times Diaz's age is 3020+40 = 3060
If ten times Diaz's age is 3060, Diaz is 3060/10 = <<3060/10=306>>306 years old.
Twenty years from now, Diaz will be 20+306 = <<20+306=326>>326 years old.
#### 326

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 300, not 3000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
